name: Topic
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Pub/Sub.

First, install @google-cloud/pubsub with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/pubsub

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/pubsubâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')();

Elsewhere

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/pubsub are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Topic
methods.description: A Topic object allows you to interact with a Cloud Pub/Sub topic.

examples.code: var topic = pubsub.topic('my-topic');

methods.name: iam
methods.description:
IAM (Identity and Access Management) allows you to set permissions on individual resources and offers a wider range of roles: editor, owner, publisher, subscriber, and viewer. This gives you greater flexibility and allows you to set more fine-grained access control.

The IAM access control features described in this document are Beta, including the API methods to get and set IAM policies, and to test IAM permissions. Cloud Pub/Sub's use of IAM features is not covered by any SLA or deprecation policy, and may be subject to backward-incompatible changes.

examples.caption: Get the IAM policy for your topic.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.flowControl.maxBytes
params.description: • The maximum number of bytes in un-acked messages to allow before the subscription pauses incoming messages. Defaults to 20% of free memory.

params.name: options.flowControl.maxMessages
params.description: • The maximum number of un-acked messages to allow before the subscription pauses incoming messages. Default: Infinity.

params.name: options.messageRetentionDuration
params.description: • Set this to override the default duration of 7 days. This value is expected in seconds. Acceptable values are in the range of 10 minutes and 7 days.

params.name: options.pushEndpoint
params.description: • A URL to a custom endpoint that messages should be pushed to.

params.name: options.retainAckedMessages
params.description: • If set, acked messages are retained in the subscription's backlog for 7 days (unless overriden by options.messageRetentionDuration). Default: false

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the topic. This will not delete subscriptions to this topic.

examples.code: topic.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: topic.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: gaxOpts.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the topic does not already exist. Default: false.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Get the official representation of this topic from the API.

examples.code: topic.getMetadata(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getSubscriptions
methods.description:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to this topic. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or an array of pubsub/subscription objects.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getSubscriptionsStream
methods.description: Get a list of the pubsub/subscription objects registered to this topic as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See pubsub/topic#getSubscriptions for a complete list of options.

methods.name: publisher
methods.description: Creates a Publisher object that allows you to publish messages to this topic.

params.name: options.batching.maxBytes
params.description: • The maximum number of bytes to buffer before sending a payload.

params.name: options.batching.maxMessages
params.description: • The maximum number of messages to buffer before sending a payload.

params.name: options.batching.maxMilliseconds
params.description: • The maximum duration to wait before sending a payload.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description: Create a Subscription object. This command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a pubsub/subscription object, which will allow you to interact with a subscription.

params.name: options.flowControl
params.description: • Flow control configurations for receiving messages. Note that these options do not persist across subscription instances.

params.name: options.flowControl.maxBytes
params.description: • The maximum number of bytes in un-acked messages to allow before the subscription pauses incoming messages. Defaults to 20% of free memory.

params.name: options.flowControl.maxMessages
params.description: • The maximum number of un-acked messages to allow before the subscription pauses incoming messages. Default: Infinity.

params.name: options.maxConnections
params.description: • Use this to limit the number of connections to be used when sending and receiving messages. Default: 5.

examples.code:
topic.iam.getPolicy(function(err, policy, apiResponse) {});

subscription.iam.getPolicy(function(err, policy, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: policy.rules
params.description: • Rules to be applied to the policy.

params.name: policy.etag
params.description: • Etags are used to perform a read-modify-write.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: iam.testPermissions
methods.description:
Test a set of permissions for a resource.

Permissions with wildcards such as * or storage.* are not allowed.

examples.caption: Test a single permission.
Test several permissions at once.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.permissions
params.description: • A subset of permissions that the caller is allowed
